fields.summary: listing empty HDFS directory returns an error instead of returning empty list

comments.body: Does that fix look right? If so I can implement and test.
[~cpcloud] has a docker image with HDFS (and Hive/Impala) that we may be able to use for testing HDFS in a portable way. I currently run the tests against a local cluster, but it's pretty ad hoc.
Here's a link to the image: https://hub.docker.com/r/cpcloud86/impala/
How should I use that?  docker run bash and build/run tests in there?  Any env vars I need to set?

Okay, I got it set up but got a failure, I think it might be failing a permission check?  Not sure yet.

[~cpcloud] maybe we can look together this afternoon?

Good news, everyone!  I got these tests to pass.  I had to run them in a separate docker container that was linked with the hdfs one though, which isn't great.  I'll try my hand at automating it tonight but don't expect to get that far.

This PR has my changes but not CI changes https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/528

I think we should deal with CI in a separate PR, though I will start working on it now.

Living proof:

I don't think we'll be able to run this CI in the main repo unless we can get Circle CI. We should set up an arrow-hadoop repository someplace (I can volunteer wesm/arrow-hadoop) where we have more admin control
Ok then, let's just focus on merging this then.
Ok then, let's just focus on merging this then.
If we are sure the error is empty directory why not just return "empty directory" ? It's unclear what the root cause is from "list directory failed".
We just worked on this again in https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/eaa60538ae776a0e4c984e6c661ba3f64def98ab. Have a look
Great but I don't see any changes to the error message.
On master branch? Can you please open a new JIRA?
